New Records: Xherdan Shaqiri became the first player from a North or South American club to score at the European Championship
Key Match Events: Germany advanced to the knockout stage with a 2-0 victory over Hungary
Albania secured a dramatic draw with Croatia (2-2)
Croatia are in danger of failing to make it out of the group
Fabian Schar's goal was initially given as an own goal, but was later reversed
Pre-Game Insights: Germany's movements are incredibly well synchronised, posing plenty of problems for opponents
Croatia's draw with Albania puts them in danger of failing to make it out of the group
Post-Match Reflections: Germany look capable of doing something special, despite potential weaknesses
Croatia will be looking to bounce back from their draw with Albania
Miscellaneous Highlights: The number of goals being scored from outside the box is a trend at Euro 2024
Comical own goals are becoming a common occurrence at the tournament
The FIFA rankings system has been criticized and overhauled several times
The precise algorithm used to calculate the rankings remains a mystery
Others: The next matches in the tournament will be Slovenia v Serbia, Denmark v England, and Spain v Italy
